Paul declares: "If the dead rise not, then is not Christ raised. And if Christ be not raised, your faith is vain; ye are yet in your sins. Then they also which are fallen asleep in Christ are perished." [1 Corinthians 15:16-18.] If for four thousand years the righteous had gone 
                                                                           367
directly to Heaven at death, how could they be said to perish, even though there should never be a resurrection?
